summary: Most frontend sections/pages, contact form submission flow, and an admin inquiries view are implemented. The backend includes inquiry submission and admin-only listing/detail methods, but persistent storage across upgrades is not evidenced, and the stored timestamp field name does not match the requested `createdAt`. The diff also introduces several features and mechanisms not requested (user profiles, admin secret-token initialization, and branding/footer attribution).

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend stores inquiries persistently in the single main Motoko actor.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows inquiries stored in in-memory `Map`/`var` fields with no `stable` variables or upgrade hooks; persistence across canister upgrades is not evidenced.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each stored inquiry includes submitted fields plus createdAt timestamp.
missing_requirements.reason: Inquiry records use a `submittedAt` field rather than the specified `createdAt` timestamp field.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile system (get/save caller profile) and a mandatory profile setup dialog after login.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest does not mention user profiles or onboarding/profile collection; only admin access via Internet Identity was requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Secret-token-based access control initialization via URL parameter (`caffeineAdminToken`) and calling `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret` on the actor.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest specifies admin authentication via Internet Identity, but does not request any secret-token bootstrap/URL-parameter mechanism.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer includes third-party attribution/link to caffeine.ai with tracking parameters.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested as part of the marketing site requirements and adds an external promotional/tracking link.
A coherent visual theme was requested, but theme-provider/dark-mode system support was not explicitly requested.
